revised_title: Phylogenetic Patterns in Abundance, Geographical Range, and Body Size of British Breeding Birds
tldr: This study examines the relationship between phylogeny, abundance, and body size of British breeding birds using a newly published dataset. The research finds a negative correlation between abundance and body size across species, but no significant correlations within non-passerine and passerine taxa considered separately. The study also investigates the correlation between geographical range and body size, finding that species' abundance and geographical range are positively correlated and both are negatively correlated with body size.
